paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2 gene and its variants, specifically focusing on the F656V mutation and its effects on hERG channel function.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 14 after experiencing syncope.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Long QT syndrome with no syncope
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 28, presenting with no syncope.
Patient P3 was evaluated at age 22 and found to be unaffected despite carrying the variant.

functional_data.summary: The F656V mutation was shown to alter the hERG channel's pharmacological sensitivity.

variants.segregation_data: The F656V variant segregates with long QT syndrome in the family.
variants.population_frequency: Not available in gnomAD or ExAC.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional assays and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the need for further investigation into the functional consequences of the F656V mutation.
key_quotes: The F656V hERG mutation was generated using the QuickChange® site-directed mutagenesis kit.
Patient P1 was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 14 after experiencing syncope.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, focusing on the KCNH2 gene.
